attributes.additional_details:
Too much time is spent taking up every last piece of park and garden in cities to make way for one or two houses.  This reduces quality of life, whilst out in the "countryside", there are miles of uninhabited land crying out for communities.

Like the Milton Keynes experiment of the 80s which was a major success, build new towns between existing cities along existing infrastructure, and allow first time buyers a real chance at affordable living, without it blighting others.
